document_data.name: Turmish
document_data.mainbody: '''Turmish''' was the language of the [[Turami]] people and the official tongue of [[Turmish]].{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|26}}
document_data.Speakers: Besides in the nation of Turmish, Turmic was spoken by folk living in [[Chessenta]], [[Cormyr]], [[Impiltur]], [[Sembia]], [[Thesk]], [[the Vast]], the [[Vilhon Reach]], the [[Western Heartlands]], and along the [[Dragon Coast]].
document_data.Script: Turmic employed the [[Thorass alphabet]], which the Turami learned from trade with the [[Chondathan]]s and [[Calishite]]s.
document_data.History: Turmic was a lone branch of the [[Thorass languages|Thorass language family]].{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|28}}

Examples.Names: Common Turmic names for women included Balama, Dona, Faila, Jalana, Luisa, Marta, Quara, Selise, and Vonda. Turmic names for males included Anton, Diero, Marcon, Pieron, Rimardo, Romero, Salazar, and Umbero. Common Turmic surnames were Agosto, Astorio, Calabra, Domine, Falone, Marivaldi, Pisacar, and Ramondo.
Examples.Dictionary:
;''A''
: 'and'

;''Amarast''
: ({{pronounce|ah|mah|RAST|refs= a respectful goodbye used by people of Turmish and sailors of the South,{{Cite web/theedverse/2022-11-12 - Amarast}}

;''Coluk''
: to absorb

;''Filidar''
: a dainty food item, picnic, or feast; for example, "a fine filidar it was, too". Derived from the name of Prince [[Filidar]].<ref>{{Cite polyhedron/71/The Everwinking Eye: Beshaba, Tymora, and Xvim|21}}

;''Jhalanrojir''
: 'mark of the rogue', given to the ''[[Pirateshield]]'' and corrupted as "Jolly Roger", the [[skull and crossbones]] symbol of pirates

;''Lammer''
: 'too much'

;''Mer''
: 'much'

;''Mer a lammer''
: 'much and too much', an idiom for excess
